snippet: Peter Cousens’s film follows two narratives: one set in Virginia and points north in 1856, the other on a trans-Atlantic slave ship in 1748.
abstract: Andy Webster reviews movie Freedom, directed by Peter Cousens and starring Cuba Gooding Jr.
lead_paragraph: Peter Cousens’s film follows two narratives: one set in Virginia and points north in 1856, the other on a trans-Atlantic slave ship in 1748.

headline.main: Review: ‘Freedom’ Stars Cuba Gooding Jr. as a Slave Fleeing to Canada
headline.print_headline: Review: ‘Freedom’ Stars Cuba Gooding Jr. as a Slave Fleeing to Canada
